üö® In 2025, BNB Chain topped all L1s in daily active users

Throughout 2025, BNB Chain averaged around 4.3 million daily active users.
At its peak, it reached roughly 4.8 million,
surpassing Solana, Near, Tron, and Aptos.

Chains where real usage is expanding ‚Äî not just price ‚Äî are starting to lead the next phase.

üö® $BNB  Chain‚Äôs Fermi upgrade lands Jan 14, 2025: block times cut from 750ms to 250ms, TPS triples to ~6,000 and selective indexing slashes node requirements.   This boosts transaction speed, lowers barriers for validators and strengthens decentralization, positioning BNB for high demand DeFi, gaming, and NFT use cases. A strategic leap in network efficiency and scalability. Ôªø#BNBChain#

‚ö° UPDATE: BNB CHAIN'S FERMI HARD FORK DROPS JAN. 14 

The upgrade is expected to reduce block times from 0.75 seconds to just 0.45 seconds. 

‚úÖ  Faster txns, better stability for time-sensitive apps, efficient indexing (no more full history downloads), and EVM optimizations.

The Fermi hard fork is important for DeFi users because blockchain networks with longer block times and lower TPS make DeFi applications prohibitive by creating lag.  Now, DeFi users can bid farewell to slippage caused by lag. 

üìä BNB Chain‚Äôs active address count has climbed to 2,871,208, nearly matching the high-throughput layer-1 blockchain Solana‚Äôs active address count. 

$BNB is chasing Visa-level speed while staying decentralized. 

Source: Nansen & Chainspect

Are whales on holiday?

It appears the Whales are staying away from the charts and touching grass.

Whale activity on major networks has decreased significantly over the past 7 days.  Compared to regular days, Whale volume has dropped by nearly 75% on Solana, Base, Ethereum, and BNB Chain.

This $BRETT whale‚Äôs (https://t.co/MldWsMmwzc) $50,000 $NOCK purchase is the highest whale activity on Base in the past 24 hours, trailed by a $2,000 investment in $virtual by a $TIBBIR top holder.

Two $wolf whaled topped their positions for a total of $7,000, while a $KLED top holder is betting $4,800 on $OPAIUM. Both transactions are some of the most notable whale moves on the Solana Network in the past 24 hours.

We hope to see the Humpback Highway open again after the Holidays.

üöÄ BNB Chain‚Äôs Fermi Upgrade: Faster Blocks, Better UX
BNB Chain is set to activate the Fermi hard fork on Jan 14, 2026, following a successful testnet upgrade on Nov 10, 2025.
The key upgrade?
‚è±Ô∏è Block time reduced from 750ms to 450ms ‚Äî meaning faster confirmations, lower latency, and higher throughput.
If performance remains stable post-launch, this could significantly boost DeFi activity, payments, and high-frequency applications, making BNB Chain even more competitive among L1s.
Speed + scalability = stronger user experience and developer adoption.
This upgrade looks bullish for the ecosystem üìà
What apps benefit the most from faster blocks in your opinion?
